analysis.Summary: This file defines and exports a single route configuration object for the Gallery page in a Vue.js application using the Martyrs framework.
analysis.Purpose: To register the `/gallery` route in the application's router, enabling lazy loading of the Gallery view component.

Components.name: gallery
responsibilities: Configure dynamic import of the Gallery.vue component.

Functions.name: component
Functions.purpose: Dynamically imports the Gallery.vue component when the route is visited, enabling code splitting.

Dependencies.usage: The Vue component rendered when `/gallery` is accessed.

analysis.Usage: This router configuration object is typically imported into a central routes array (e.g., in `router/index.js`), where it is merged with other module routes to build the full Vue Router configuration.
Notes: Uses a webpackChunkName comment (`'Gallery'`) to name the generated code-split chunk.
The `meta.title_hide` flag likely controls layout behavior such as hiding the page title in the UI.
No additional guards or children routes are defined here; this is a leaf route.
